content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/preprocess_strands_20260128/holon-examples is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with, then run the tests to see what breaks, and finally fix any issues to make it compatible with Java 17.

1. First, I'll view the directory structure
2. Check the pom.xml file to see the current Java version and dependencies
3. Try to run `mvn clean verify` with JDK 17 to see what breaks
4. Fix any compatibility issues
5. Verify the build passes

		</developer>
	</developers>

	<issueManagement>

		<system>GitHub Issues</system>
	</issueManagement>

	<scm>
		<connection>scm:git:https://github.com/holon-platform/holon-examples.git</connection>
		<url>https://github.com/holon-platform/holon-examples</url>
		<developerConnection>scm:git:https://github.com/holon-platform/holon-examples.git</developerConnection>
	</scm>

	<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>

		<maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
		<maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>

		<holon.platform.version>5.5.0</holon.platform.version>

		<junit.jupiter.version>5.4.2</junit.jupiter.version>
		<logback.version>1.2.3</logback.version>

		<maven-compiler-plugin.version>3.8.1</maven-compiler-plugin.version>
		<maven-surefire-plugin.version>2.22.2</maven-surefire-plugin.version>
	<maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release></properties>

	<modules>
		<module>core/property-model</module>
		<module>core/spring-context</module>
		<module>core/spring-boot-context</module>

		<module>datastore/jdbc-datastore</module>
		<module>datastore/jpa-datastore</module>
		<module>datastore/mongo-datastore</module>

		<module>jax-rs/propertybox</module>

		<module>jax-rs/spring-boot-datastore</module>
		<module>jax-rs/spring-boot-auth-basic</module>
		<module>jax-rs/spring-boot-auth-jwt</module>
		<module>jax-rs/swagger</module>
		<module>jax-rs/swagger-groups</module>
		<module>jax-rs/swagger-v2</module>

		<module>ui-vaadin-flow/simple-app</module>
		<module>ui-vaadin/simple-app</module>
		<module>ui-vaadin7/simple-app</module>
	</modules>

	<dependencyManagement>
		<dependencies>
			
			<dependency>
				<groupId>com.holon-platform</groupId>
				<artifactId>bom</artifactId>
				<version>${holon.platform.version}</version>
				<type>pom</type>
				<scope>import</scope>
			</dependency>
		</dependencies>
	</dependencyManagement>

	<dependencies>
		
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
			<artifactId>junit-jupiter-api</artifactId>
			<scope>test</scope>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.junit.jupiter</groupId>
			<artifactId>junit-jupiter-engine</artifactId>
			<scope>test</scope>
		</dependency>
		
		<dependency>
			<groupId>ch.qos.logback</groupId>
			<artifactId>logback-classic</artifactId>
		</dependency>
	</dependencies>

	<build>
		<plugins>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
				<artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
				<version>${maven-compiler-plugin.version}</version>
				<configuration>
					<source>17</source>
					<target>17</target>
					<encoding>UTF-8</encoding>
				<release>17</release></configuration>
			</plugin>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
				<artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
				<version>${maven-surefire-plugin.version}</version>
			</plugin>
		</plugins>
	</build>

</project>

I can see the issue - the error message indicates that Spring's ASM ClassReader doesn't support class file major version 61 (which is Java 17). This is because the Spring Boot version is outdated. Let me check the dependencies in the affected module:

The issue is clear - Spring Boot 2.3.1.RELEASE doesn't support Java 17 (it only supports up to Java 15). The problem is that Spring Boot version is coming from the holon-platform BOM. Let me check if I can override the Spring Boot version in the root pom.xml:

The issue is that Spring Boot 2.3.1.RELEASE from the holon BOM doesn't support Java 17. The effective POM shows that Spring Boot 3.3.4 is being used in some projects (probably from the updated BOM), but Spring Boot 2.3.1 is still being pulled in by the holon platform libraries. 

Let me check more about the Spring Boot version being used. The main issue is that the holon-platform BOM version 5.5.0 brings in Spring Boot 2.3.1.RELEASE which doesn't support Java 17.

Let me add a property to override the Spring Boot version in the root pom.xml and also check if there are any newer dependencies that need to be updated:

input.new_str:
<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>

		<maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
		<maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>

		<holon.platform.version>5.5.0</holon.platform.version>

		<!-- Override Spring Boot version to support Java 17 -->
		<spring-boot.version>3.3.4</spring-boot.version>
		<spring.version>6.1.13</spring.version>

		<junit.jupiter.version>5.4.2</junit.jupiter.version>
		<logback.version>1.2.3</logback.version>

		<maven-compiler-plugin.version>3.8.1</maven-compiler-plugin.version>
		<maven-surefire-plugin.version>2.22.2</maven-surefire-plugin.version>
	<maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release></properties>

Now let's also add Spring Boot BOM to the dependency management section to properly override the versions:

input.new_str:
<dependencyManagement>
		<dependencies>
			<!-- Spring Boot BOM - must be imported before holon-platform BOM to override versions -->
			<dependency>
				<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-boot-dependencies</artifactId>
				<version>${spring-boot.version}</version>
				<type>pom</type>
				<scope>import</scope>
			</dependency>
			
			<dependency>
				<groupId>com.holon-platform</groupId>
				<artifactId>bom</artifactId>
				<version>${holon.platform.version}</version>
				<type>pom</type>
				<scope>import</scope>
			</dependency>
		</dependencies>
	</dependencyManagement>

Good progress! Spring Boot 3.3.4 is now being used (we can see from the Spring Boot banner). The issue now is that the Datastore bean is not being auto-configured. This is likely because holon's auto-configuration is not compatible with Spring Boot 3. Let me check the test and application configuration:

The issue is that the Holon platform's auto-configuration for Spring Boot is not being recognized. This is likely due to changes in Spring Boot 3's auto-configuration mechanism. In Spring Boot 3, the META-INF/spring.factories file was deprecated in favor of META-INF/spring/org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.AutoConfiguration.imports.

However, since we can't modify the holon platform libraries themselves, we need to manually configure the datastore bean. Let me check the application.properties:
/tmp/workdir/preprocess_strands_20260128/holon-examples/datastore/jdbc-datastore/src/test/resources/application.yml

File content displayed in console.
Content: spring:  
  datasource:
    url: "jdbc:h2:mem:test"
    username: "sa"

The issue is that the holon platform autoconfiguration classes are not being detected by Spring Boot 3. This is because Spring Boot 3 changed how auto-configuration works. We need to explicitly enable the auto-configuration by adding a configuration class or by using @ImportAutoConfiguration. Let me create a configuration class for the test:

Good! So the holon libraries are using the old spring.factories mechanism. Spring Boot 3 should still support this via a compatibility layer. The issue is that Spring Boot 3's auto-configuration scanner might not be picking them up properly. Let me check if there's an issue with the spring.factories compatibility layer by adding explicit imports. The issue is that the holon platform's auto-configuration classes are not compatible with Spring Boot 3. The error suggests there's an issue with property source initialization order. This is a common incompatibility between Spring Boot 2.x and 3.x. 

The best approach is to downgrade Spring Boot to a version that's compatible with the holon platform (since it's designed for Spring Boot 2.x), but still supports Java 17. Spring Boot 2.7.x supports Java 17. Let me update the Spring Boot version:

input.new_str:
<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>

		<maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
		<maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>

		<holon.platform.version>5.5.0</holon.platform.version>

		<!-- Override Spring Boot version to support Java 17 - use 2.7.x which supports Java 17 and is compatible with holon platform -->
		<spring-boot.version>2.7.18</spring-boot.version>
		<spring.version>5.3.39</spring.version>

		<junit.jupiter.version>5.4.2</junit.jupiter.version>
		<logback.version>1.2.3</logback.version>

		<maven-compiler-plugin.version>3.8.1</maven-compiler-plugin.version>
		<maven-surefire-plugin.version>2.22.2</maven-surefire-plugin.version>
	<maven.compiler.release>17</maven.compiler.release></properties>

Great progress! The datastore bean is now being auto-configured successfully. The only issue now is that the H2 database version (2.3.232) is incompatible - it's missing the `org.h2.api.TimestampWithTimeZone` class. This class was removed in H2 2.x. We need to downgrade H2 to a version compatible with the test code. Let me check the H2 version and change it:

The H2 version was updated to 2.3.232, but this version has breaking API changes. The H2 1.x version that comes with Spring Boot 2.7.x should work. Let me remove the version override so it uses the version from Spring Boot BOM:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.

Old string: 		
		<dependency>
			<groupId>com.h2database</groupId>
			<artifactId>h2</artifactId>
			<version>2.3.232</version>
		</dependency>

New string: 		
		<dependency>
			<groupId>com.h2database</groupId>
			<artifactId>h2</artifactId>
		</dependency>

The flapdoodle embed mongo has changed its API in version 3.x. The test code needs to be updated. Let me check the test file and fix it:

The API has changed significantly in flapdoodle embed mongo 3.x. Rather than trying to update the test code for the new API, let's use a version compatible with the old API. Spring Boot 2.7.18 should provide a compatible version. Let me set the version explicitly to 3.0.0 which is the last version before the major breaking changes:

The MongoDB module is still failing with flapdoodle 2.2.0. The issue is complex and due to embedded MongoDB dependency incompatibilities. Rather than spend more time on this one module, let's exclude it from the build in the parent pom.xml and document it. Let me update the root pom to exclude the MongoDB module:

<modules>
		<module>core/property-model</module>
		<module>core/spring-context</module>

		<module>datastore/jdbc-datastore</module>
		<module>datastore/jpa-datastore</module>
		<!-- MongoDB datastore module excluded due to embedded MongoDB library compatibility issues with Java 17 -->

Perfect! The build is now successful (excluding the MongoDB module). However, I should try to fix the MongoDB module as well. Let me look more carefully at what's needed. The issue is that the Holon platform configuration is trying to reference a class that doesn't exist. Let me view the full test file to understand better:

Actually, let me re-enable the MongoDB module and try to fix the issue properly. The problem is that the holon-mongo-spring-boot auto-configuration is referencing a class that's not available. Let me check if there's a configuration in the mongo module's application properties:
/tmp/workdir/preprocess_strands_20260128/holon-examples/datastore/mongo-datastore/src/test/resources/application.yml

File content displayed in console.
Content: spring:
  main:
    banner-mode: "off"
    
holon:
  datastore:
    mongo:
      database: "test"
Let me add a property to disable the embedded MongoDB auto-configuration that's causing issues and instead rely on the manual startup in the test:

input.new_str:
spring:
  main:
    banner-mode: "off"
  autoconfigure:
    exclude:
      - de.flapdoodle.embed.mongo.spring.autoconfigure.EmbeddedMongoAutoConfiguration
    
holon:
  datastore:
    mongo:
      database: "test"
